keyMoments.title: Franky Destroyer Cannons Revealed
keyMoments.description: Franky unveils his Destroyer Cannons, two powerful cannons mounted on his shoulders, claiming they fire pursuit cannonballs.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases one of Franky's signature weapons and demonstrates his unique cyborg abilities.
keyMoments.quote: These are my Franky Destroyer Cannons! You can't dodge pursuit cannonballs!

keyMoments.title: Strong Hammer Demolishes Wall
keyMoments.description: Franky removes the skin on his right hand, revealing a pure iron fist underneath, and launches Fukurou through a wall.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's raw physical power and cyborg construction.

keyMoments.title: Franky Defeats Fukurou
keyMoments.description: Franky defeats Fukurou using Franky Centaur and a devastating Coup de Vent at point-blank range, winning with a victorious 'SUPER!' exclamation.
keyMoments.significance: Franky's first major solo victory in the Enies Lobby arc, proving his strength and value as an ally.

abilities.description: Shoulder-mounted cannons that fire powerful cannonballs.
Franky removes his hand's skin to reveal a pure iron fist for devastating punches.
Splits his legs vertically to create a reverse centaur formation for stability and grappling.
Fires a massive cannonball of compressed air from connected arms, one of his most powerful attacks.

keyMoments.title: Fukurou Defeated by Franky
keyMoments.description: Fukurou is defeated by Franky's Coup de Vent attack and sent crashing into the ground, eliminating him from the battle.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the defeat of one of CP9's agents and reduces their fighting force.

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Unconventional Fighting Style - Sogeking as a Katana
keyMoments.description: Unable to use his right hand due to handcuffs, Zoro holds Sogeking in his right hand while Sogeking grips a katana, essentially using Sogeking as a replacement sword.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most unique and comedic fighting techniques in the series, demonstrating Zoro's adaptability.
keyMoments.quote: I'll just use you as my third sword!

keyMoments.title: Sogeking's Failed Manipulation Strategy
keyMoments.description: Sogeking attempts to exploit the rivalry between Kaku and Jabra but Zoro ruins the plan by openly stating what Sogeking is trying to do.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases the dynamic between Zoro's straightforward nature and Usopp's tactical thinking.

keyMoments.title: Becoming Zoro's 'Third Sword'
keyMoments.description: Usopp (as Sogeking) is forced to become Zoro's improvised third sword, holding a katana while being wielded by Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: Forces Usopp into direct confrontation despite his preference for ranged combat.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper Encounters Kumadori
keyMoments.description: After Franky's victory over Fukurou, Chopper encounters Kumadori who has escaped from his previous containment.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Chopper's battle against a formidable CP9 opponent.

keyMoments.title: Chopper Prepares to Use Rumble Ball
keyMoments.description: Facing Kumadori's overwhelming power, Chopper prepares to consume a Rumble Ball to transform.
keyMoments.significance: Foreshadows Chopper's dangerous Monster Point transformation in the next episode.

keyMoments.title: Kumadori Demonstrates Seimei Kikan
keyMoments.description: Kumadori reveals his signature technique, Seimei Kikan (Life Return), which allows him to control every part of his body through conscious focus, including manipulating his hair and body weight.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the Seimei Kikan technique to the series, representing advanced martial arts mastery beyond normal Rokushiki.
keyMoments.quote: Seimei Kikan! Through my training as a hermit, I can control every part of my body!

abilities.description: Life Return - allows complete control of body parts through conscious focus, including hair manipulation and body weight control.

reveals.information: Can use Seimei Kikan to control his entire body
